citation.article-title: Bacteroides xylanolyticus sp. nov., a xylanolytic bacterium from methane producing cattle manure

p.s: Description of Bacteroides xylanolyticus sp. nov.
Bacteroides xylanolyticus (xyl.an.o.ly'ti.cus Gr.n.lysis dissolution, N.L. adj. xylanolyticus xylan dissolving)
Straight rods, 2.0 to 3.0 by 0.4 to 0.6 μm with tapered ends.
Ferments glucose, lactose, maltose, salicin, mannose, raffinose, rhamnose, trehalose, arabinose, cellobiose, xylose, xylan.
The hemicelluloses gum xanthan, laminaran, locust bean gum, and gum arabic were not utilized.
Fermentation products are hydrogen, carbon dioxide, acetate and ethanol.
Optimum temperature between 25°C and 40°C; no growth at 10° and 45°C. pH.
Enrichment culture from fermenting cattle manure.
This strain has been deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung yon Mikroorganismen (DSM) under accession number DSM 3808.
